newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq retreats from record, dragged by Intel.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq retreats from record, dragged by Intel.

text.p: Nasdaq stocks pulled back from their record levels on Wednesday, dragged by selling in market heavyweight Intel Corp following its earnings report.

The Nasdaq composite unofficially shed 12.66 points, or 0.94 percent, to 1333.70, retreating from Tuesday's record high close. Intel dropped 4-7/8 to 142-1/4, despite posting fourth quarter earnings after the market's close Tuesday well ahead of Wall Street consensus expectations. But traders said Intel's comments it expects first quarter 1997 revenues to be about flat with revenues of $6.4 billion in the fourth quarter, created some jitters in the tech-heavy Nasdaq market.
"Nasdaq has mirrored its bellwether, Intel, today," said Peter Coolidge, senior equity trader at Brean Murray and Co. "There's just been some sloppiness in techs."
Among other leading tech stocks, Microsoft Corp slipped 3/4 to 84-5/8, Oracle Corp dropped two to 41-1/4 and Cisco Systems Inc dipped 1-3/4 to 70-3/8.
Tencor Instruments shot up 5-3/8 to 35-7/8 on news it was merging with semi-conductor equipment maker KLA Instruments Corp, which ended down 3/8 to 40-1/2.
